faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

label.en: 18/19 A regular part 1 3 CP LT Eng
label.et: 18/19 S PÕ 1. osa 3 EAP LT Eng

description.en: Each semester, we will take an in-depth look at a different topic in artificial intelligence fundamentally related to natural human intelligence. We will focus on reading, analysing and actively discussing scientific articles.
description.et: Igal semestril käsitleme sügavuti erinevat tehisintellekti valdkonda, mis on olulisel määral seotud inimese loomuliku intelligentsi ja selle arenguga. Keskendume teadusartiklite lugemisele, analüüsimisele ja aktiivsele arutelule.

objectives.en: The student will learn about the state of the art and the challenges of one of the topics at the intersection of natural and artificial intelligence.
objectives.et: Üliõpilane tutvub õppimist toetavas keskkonnas ühe loomuliku- ja tehisintellekti kokkupuutepunktis oleva teema hetkeseisu ja väljakutsetega.

learning_outcomes.en: By the end of the course, the student has an overview of the theoretical and practical aspects and issues in the field. The student will be able to summarise and critically evaluate key research articles in the field and to lead and participate in discussions.
learning_outcomes.et: Kursuse lõpuks on õpilasel ülevaade valdkonna teoreetilistest ja praktilistest aspektidest ja probleemidest. Õpilane oskab kokku võtta ja kriitiliselt hinnata põhilisi valdkonna teadusartikleid ning juhtida ja osaleda aruteludes.

independent_work.et:
A student will need to:
- Browse the scientific article repositories and read abstracts to find a suitable article for presentation
- Read the selected article several times to form a deep understanding of the material
- Prepare a set of slides to clearly and in detail explain the contents of the article to other students
- Make an oral presentation

description.et: The presentation is evaluated by the quality of the information presented, the level of clarity and the level of organization.

grade_preconditions.et:
Collect 70 points.
In justified circumstances, the student and teachers can set a small project if the minimum attendance is not reached.

grade_evaluation.et:
To pass the course you need to score 70 points.
Points come from presentation(s), attendance and tests.
More detailed description here: https://courses.cs.ut.ee/2016/neuroseminar/fall

debt_elimination.et: In justified circumstances, the student and teacher can set an extended deadline.

resources.mandatory_materials: The proposed reading materials will be given at the start of the course.
resources.recommended_materials: A list of suggested articles on the current research in Neuroscience is maintained at the course web page: https://courses.cs.ut.ee/2016/neuroseminar

structural_unit.address:

description.et: Information is provided at https://courses.cs.ut.ee/ website

audience.et: The course in mainly addressed to the Master and Doctorate programs as well as to 3rd year Bachelor students. Students interested in acquiring a perspective in modern neuroscience and computational neuroscience research
